org.jppf.node.protocol

Class ScriptedTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jppf.node.protocol.AbstractTask<T>
      • org.jppf.node.protocol.ScriptedTask<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of result returned by this task.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Runnable, Task<T>

    public class ScriptedTask<T>
extends AbstractTask<T>
    A task implementation which executes a script in a specified JSR 223 (javax.script APIs) script language.

    In addition to the user-specified bindings, this task always provides to the script engine a reference to itself with the name 'jppfTask'.

    A reusableId can be specified via the constructors, indicating that, if the script engine has that capability, compiled scripts will be stored and reused, to avoid compiling the same scripts repeatedly.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Map<String,Object> bindings
      The bindings provide varibles available to the script engien during execution of the script.
      protected String language
      The JSR 223 script language to use.
      protected String reusableId
      Unique identifier for the script, which allows reusing a compiled version if one has already been produced.
      protected String script
      The script to execute from this task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScriptedTask

        protected ScriptedTask()
        Default constructor provided as a convenience for subclassing.

      • ScriptedTask

        public ScriptedTask(String language,
            String script,
            String reusableId,
            Map<String,Object> bindings)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this task with the specified script language, script provided as a string, and a set of variable bindings to be used in the scripts.
        Parameters:
        language - the JSR 223 script language to use.
        script - the script to execute from this task.
        reusableId - a unique identifier for the script, which allows reusing a compiled version if one has already been produced.
        bindings - a set of variables that will be available to the script.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if language or script is null.

      • ScriptedTask

        public ScriptedTask(String language,
            Reader scriptReader,
            String reusableId,
            Map<String,Object> bindings)
             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                    IOException
        Initialize this task with the specified script language, script provided from a Reader, and a set of variable bindings to be used in the scripts.
        Parameters:
        language - the JSR 223 script language to use.
        scriptReader - a reader form which to read the script source.
        reusableId - a unique identifier for the script, which allows reusing a compiled version if one has already been produced.
        bindings - a set of variables that will be available to the script.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if language or script is null.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the script source.

      • ScriptedTask

        public ScriptedTask(String language,
            File scriptFile,
            String reusableId,
            Map<String,Object> bindings)
             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                    IOException
        Initialize this task with the specified script language, script provided as a file, and a set of variable bindings to be used in the scripts.
        Parameters:
        language - the JSR 223 script language to use.
        scriptFile - a file from which to read the script source.
        reusableId - a unique identifier for the script, which allows reusing a compiled version if one has already been produced.
        bindings - a set of variables that will be available to the script.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if language or script is null.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the script source.

      • removeBinding

        public Object removeBinding(String name)
        Remove the specified variable from the user-defined bindings.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable binding to remove.
        Returns:
        the value of the variable, or null if the variable was not bound.
